realm.name: platform-manager
realm.description: Users with role platform-manager can access all resources in the deployment but the security admin console (Keycloak GUI).

realm.name: security-adminer
realm.description: Role with all permissions in one realm. Security-adminer can access Keycloak admin console for users, roles, groups, and applications management.

realm.name: data-expert
realm.description: Users with role data-expert can access tools that retrieves and analyses data: Data Lake tools, Data Analytics and Visual Analytics.

realm.name: interoperability-expert
realm.description: Users with role interoperability-expert can access tools related with the interoperability layer (SIL tools).

realm.name: user
realm.description: User is the role provided after the registration. User can access public resources being identified by the access control module.

realm.name: developer
realm.description: Users with role developer can access IDE tools: AIOTES IDE, Code generator, Source code template, Service composer and ClickDigital.

realm.name: deployer
realm.description: Users with role deployer can access deployment technology tools, deployment tools and iot infrastructure management tools. Tools under the common uri /deployment-tools

policies.name: Default Policy
policies.description: A policy that grants access only for users within this realm

config.code:
// by default, grants any permission associated with this policy
$evaluation.grant();

policies.name: Default Permission
policies.description: A permission that applies to the default resource type

clientScopes.name: web-origins
clientScopes.description: OpenID Connect scope for add allowed web origins to the access token

clientScopes.name: roles
clientScopes.description: OpenID Connect scope for add user roles to the access token

authenticationFlows.description: Handle what to do if there is existing account with same email/username like authenticated identity provider
Used by Docker clients to authenticate against the IDP
Actions taken after first broker login with identity provider account, which is not yet linked to any Keycloak account
Username, password, otp and other auth forms.
An authentication flow based on challenge-response HTTP Authentication Schemes
Reset credentials for a user if they forgot their password or something
